publicationStmt.p: La table des poésies de troubadours contenues dans ce manuscript, qui provient des d'Urfé, a été publiée par M. Paul Meyer dans la Bibliothèque de l'École des Chartes (1871), t. XXXI, p. 412-458.Ms. I de M. P. Meyer ; ms. R de Karl Bartsch ; cf. aussi le Catalogue des livres de la bibliothèque de La Vallière, 1re partie, t. II, p. 152-158, n° 2701.

msIdentifier.repository: Bibliothèque nationale de France, Département des manuscrits

msContents.textLang: The primary language in this manuscript is Occitan

msItem.title: Bibliographic Information
msItem.note: Red stamp on top right of page; red circle outline with circular text surrounding an eagle; all red. Most likely for BnF. No. 2701 Lauall. No. 14

msItem.title: Missing Pages
msItem.note: Volume de 148 Feuillets, Solus les Feuillets préliminaires A.B.C.; Moins le Feuilles 84 - 30 Août 1870

msItem.title: Bibliographic Information
msItem.note: Wormholes, Library Seal. Significant scribbles. 1) in shape of an S 2) two concentric circles. Water damage to right corners. “Bornelh” written in bottom left margin

msItem.title: Manuscript Condition
msItem.note: Many small ink blotches/darker patches, where small corrections or accentuations appear to have been made. Continues on verso side and beyond

msItem.title: Page Description
msItem.note: Lack of writing on right side of page. Calligraphy changes here from previous part of manuscript, ¼ way down page: becomes smaller and tighter as well as more compact. Verso side of folio has no writing at all. Serves as a separation between bibliographic information and foreword and the poems and works of troubadours.

msItem.title: Manuscript Description
msItem.note: Looks as if the folio is made up of separate leafs/pieces of parchment glued together to make a proper sheet; Significant damage. Folio laid on paper pulp to form a full sheet. Every initial historiated.

msItem.title: Damage Description
msItem.note: Minor staining/darkening of page itself. Bottom left of page missing in a clean, crescent fashion: this is the neck of cow: visible veins. Lower quality parchment It appears that there is color from the previous page’s initials that bled through the page. Appears almost exclusively in the margins.

msItem.title: Non Textual Elements
msItem.note: A number “50” is sloppily written in the dextral margin and it appears to have come at a much later date. The number 51 is written in the margin next to the following song/poem. The numbers are written sequentially by every initial in the manuscript, « Reis glorios » having the 50th initial in the codex, and this also indicates the number of the poem that the initial starts

filiation.p: "Reis Glorios" is presented in Manuscript R, Chanson la Vallière, in the order outlined in the text body, such that the coblas are organized 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7. Some antigraphs present the order of the coblas as 1, 2, 3, 5, 4, 6, 7 when compared to the order in Manuscript R.

support.p: Parchment. Lower quality parchment, flesh and hair sides clearly distinguishable; recto is hair side and verso is flesh side.

supportDesc.foliation: Original foliation to manuscript denoting folios in top right of page of each recto folio; modern pencil foliation denoting poems in margins next to each poem.

layoutDesc.layout: 2 columns throughout manuscript, except when divided into 4, 5, and sometimes 6 columns starting on folio 114r.

handDesc.handNote: Gothic handwriting by one hand, except on folio 4r, when hand becomes much smaller and compact. Reverts back to normal after that.

musicNotation.p: Square notation on 4-line staff for the first cobla of certain poems, including "Reis Glorios".

decoDesc.decoNote: Flower and sword motif on the initial of "Reis Glorios"; no other historiation is present. In the next poem, there is an initial with a heron with a flower in its mouth emerging from the top. The heron is atop a historiated initial, a rectangular box with a figure that has a red cap and red shirt. Below the initial is a yellow figure with black eyes and tongue sticking out.
Hand in the margin pointing out a line at the top of the second column on folio 8v, top right of folio.
G• de Bornelh in red; author names at the end of lines rather than the beginning, written in red. "B" in "bel companho" rubricated at the beginning of each cobla; there is also some blue associated.

Large letter R that is the initial to "Reis Glorios as the poem begins. The R is in blue with many flowers draw on it and one in it. The left top has a small hat-like figure attached to it, with small red/orange "balls" on the ends of the hat. The left stem is very long and stylized. Three-pointed tip drawn onto the stem, possibly meant to look like a flower as well.

binding.p: Red leather with gilt edges, heavily worn and scratched

notatedMusic.desc: The opening cobla of Reis Glorios is presented in the manuscript by three lines of music and one half line. The music consists of a four-line staff with square notes and the key undisclosed, with the words underneath the notes. Some of the notes are whole notes, with one note corresponding to one syllable. At other times, a syllable has three to a maximum of five corresponding notes (read uenguda). The stem on the square notes extends downwards, and the squares will touch if there are more than one note corresponding to one syllable. An ornamental marginalia in the form of a stemless P (missing the second leg of an R), and extends vertically nearly the exact length of the four lines of song. The music reintegrates with the text without a closing bar to the lines of music, but the 2nd cobla commences with a large, rubricated B leading into Bel Companho.

lg.l: Rei glorios uray vray lums e clartatz.

Totz poderos
senher si auos a vos platz.

Al mieu compaynh sias fizels ai
da.
Quieu non lo ui pus la nucch fo uenguda.
Bel conpanho si dormetz o uelhatz velhatz .

Non dor
mas pus. Senher flauos flavos platz

Quen aurien uey vey
lestrela creguda

Caduç lo iorn, qu’eu lay ben co
noguda.

Bel conpanho, en chantan
uos vos apel.

Non durmas
pus qu’eu aug chantar lauzel.
Qu’eu uay vay quien lo iorn per lo boscatie

et
ay paor, quel gilos uos vos assatie.

Bel conpanho, pos mi par
ti de uos vos ,
Yeu non durmi nim muoc de ginolhos.

Ans pregieu di
eu lo filh Santa Maria,
Queus mi rendes per lial conpanhia
Bel companho, issetz al fenestrel,
et esgardatz las ensenhas del cel.

co
noysiret sien soy fizel messatie.

Si non o faytz uostres vostres er lo danp
natie
Bel companho la foras al pero.

Me preiauatz preiavatz
queeu no fos dormilhos.
Enans uelhes velhes tota nueg tro ad dia.

Aras
nous platz mos chans ni ma paria.

Bel dos conpanh
tan soy en ric sojorn.
Queeu no uolgra volgra mays fos alba ni jorn.

Car
la genfenser queeu anc nasques nas de mayre.

tenc et abras. Per queeu non pre
zi gaire.
Lo fol gilos ni lalba. G de bornelh
